reference.title: The conref attribute
reference.shortdesc: The conref attribute is used to reference content that can be reused. It allows reuse of DITA elements, including topic or map level elements.

section.p: The value of the conref attribute must be a URI reference to a DITA element. See for details on specifying URI references to DITA elements. As with other DITA references, a conref attribute that references a resource without an ID is treated as a reference to the first topic or map in the document.
section.note: When using the conref attribute on an element, the content of that element is ignored. For example, if a phrase is marked up like this:<ph conref="#topic/ph">Something</ph> the word "Something" will be replaced by the content of the referenced ph element.
